alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 4:16PM MST until August 22 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, southwest Cochise and eastern Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms near and south of Elgin. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Slaughter House Wash, Turkey Creek and Babocomari River. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Elgin, Fort Huachuca and Canelo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
